The claim is supported by a statement fr: S. Rep. Rush Holt, who claims that a clear majority of Americans support removing the cost-sharing requirement for prescription contraceptive coverage.
The claim is backed by a February health: which found that 63 percent of respondents support the new federal requirement that private health insurance plans cover the cost of birth control.
The claim is further supported by a CBS: New York Times poll, which found that 66 percent of Americans support the plan requiring private health insurance plans to cover the full cost of birth control.
Multiple surveys: including the ones mentioned above, have been conducted to gauge public opinion on requiring health care plans to cover birth control, and most of them support Holt's claim.
